reviewDescription: This product caused my mouth to peel after brushing. All day long my cheek and mouth tissue will slough off, and it's disgusting and embarrassing. This happens with a large number of toothpastes, and it's kind of a crapshoot--more often a gel than a paste (and I've tried SLS free and all the other hippie things). The taste isn't that great. I find it to be kind of acidic and it burns my tongue if I have a crack (I have geographic tongue). I don't feel like it keeps my mouth minty fresh for very long at all. I much prefer a paste to the gel. This product is a fail for me, and I'll be tossing out a nearly full tube.
reviewTitle: In the garbage along with my cheek tissue

reviewDescription: Every so often my teeth get sensitive to cold drinks. Thank heavens it is not all the time but when it happens I start brushing with Sensodyne toothpaste and it really works. It takes about a week or two but the sensitivity begins to diminish and eventually stops. My dentist has me alternate using this along with Colgate PreviDent 5000. Between the two toothpastes they are helping to relieve my tooth sensitivity.My dentist recommended this to me years ago and I always have some on hand. I don't have to use it all the time as my sensitivity does go away but if I had to use this toothpaste all the time I wouldn't mind. It works well, cleans my teeth properly and will freshen your mouth.I recommend this if you are having issues with cold, hot, or sweet drinks!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020

reviewDescription: I've been using this for several weeks and am now about 75% of the way through the tube.The product is gentle on my teeth but too harsh on my gums. Usually, I brush three times per day, but that made my gums burn. I switched to another brand  for a week then went back to this but only used it once per day, then worked up to using it twice a day over about two weeks. Doing that has allowed me to at least get some use of the product, but every so often I still need to cut back to once a day or switch to another product when my gums get irritated.Though this product cleans my teeth, it doesn't do much in terms of whitening. I notice a definite difference when I switch to other brands which are more effective in that department. Although my main concern was getting something that would clean my teeth without irritating them, I'm a little disappointed that it doesn't really whiten my teeth. I found the taste a bit strong at first but not unpleasant.The shipment itself was fine. The product was properly sealed and undamaged. As far as I can tell, this is genuine product and not a knockoff.I've used Sensodyne products in the past and been very happy with them, so I was very surprised and disappointed by this. Maybe it works well for others, but I won't be buying it again.

reviewDescription: I always have a sensodyne tube in the rotation ever since my dentist recommended it and I often have it on order from Subscribe & Save. Somehow I mistakenly ordered this blue gel kind or they sent it by accident. I prefer to leave the useless and poisonous dyes out of things but cracked it open and have been (trying to) use it anyway. Wish I hadn’t though and had just returned it. It is so sharply spicy that I cannot brush even half as long as usual because it just straight up burns. And I am an essential oil puller. Meaning, I regularly swish very spicy oils in my mouth - and enjoy it. But this is a very different sensation. And it’s just my experience of course, yours may differ!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 14, 2020

reviewDescription: Great product!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 30, 2018

reviewDescription: So a few weeks ago, I received the Sensodyne Deep Clean toothpaste from BzzAgent, and I told my family members and a few friends that I got it for free. I told them I have been getting really sensitive to really hot foods like soups and even simple stuff like eating oranges or grapefruits. Even when I use Crest or Colgate, their mint flavor causes my teeth to burn. So, when I tried out Sensodyne's Deep Clean toothpaste, it was surprisingly wasn't abrasive at all. The mint flavor is subtle, yet my mouth feels clean. I don't taste any sugar aftertaste which is wonderful. My teeth feels squeaky clean, but the added blue coloring is kind of difficult to remove, but I just wash it out with some alcohol free mouthwash.A couple of my friends wanted to try some, so I bought them the trial/travel size for their travel trip to Los Angeles. They agreed that it cleans while doesn't have that burning minty sensation.I've recently discovered Proenamel by Sensodyne, so I am excited to try more of their products prior to my free sample from Sensodyne and BzzAgent. My review is 100% honest and to the best of my knowledge. Thanks again for the free sample :)
